content.description: Start climbing up a steep 5.8 bulge passing two bolts to a runout 4th class ramp. Stay right, following big features to the third bolt. Ascend the arête up the right side of the face, passing a total of nine bolts to a scenic belay on the summit spire.
content.protection: 9 bolts to chain anchor on summit.
content.location: Rope up at the right toe of the buttress. This is the farthest right route on Black Tower. A good strategy is to bring up the follower and either rappel with 70M rope or scramble off to right. (Possible to rap off to right side with 60M rope. Knot the ends of your rope and be careful!)

content.description:
Sky Raider ascends the center of Black Tower's face directly to the summit anchor on excellent rock. It is slightly steeper and perhaps harder than Wingman.

There are two possible starts to this route. Either start on Wingman and traverse left across runout 4th class ramp after the second bolt to reach Sky Raider’s bolt line OR start at a large fir tree on the left side of the tower and climb 4th class features (passing a bush) until you come to the high first bolt. Use a long sling on the first bolt.
content.protection: 7 bolts (130') if using left start, 9 bolts if using Wingman's start. Climb to shared chain anchors on top of the spire.
content.location: Ascends center of main face. Bring up the follower and rappel to base of Wingman with a 70M rope or scramble off to right. (Possible to rap off the right side with 60M rope. Tie a knot in your rope ends and be careful!)

content.description: Screw Cap is a 20' boulder problem that climbs the steep detached block left of the route Corkscrew. It traverses upward on a left to right trajectory on generally good holds.
content.location: On the detached boulder left of the routes Barrel Roll and Corkscrew, far left side of Black Tower.

content.description: Start up steep juggy features on red rock to a shelf, then climb and laugh your way up a wildly featured overhanging arete with big jugs, finishing on a slab with anchor chains.
Slab to bulge to steep face/arete. Runout on easy terrain/big features above the last bolt. A bit funky but fun.
content.location: This is the right of the two routes around the far left side of Black tower.

climbs.name: "Black Arrow"
climbs.fa: Jerry Dodrill, Kurt Jensen, Jared Chaney, 1995

content.description: Starting at the left side of the tower's base, This trad line climbs features and hollow cracks to the summit. It was the first route done on the cliff, ground up, in 1995 or so. We initially called it "Never Again" because it scared he crap out of us. Today you can climb it a bit more safely by clipping a couple bolts on the route Sky Raider then moving up and right into the cracks and following features between Sky Raider and Wingman.
content.protection: Gear to 3". Rappel chains on summit, or scramble off and descend to right.
content.location: Start at a large fir tree at the lower left toe of the Black Tower buttress. Climb up the gully through a bush, up features to a series of crack features that ascend the center of Black Tower.
